Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameEngine

  • public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to handle the motion and interaction with the physics and collisions involved. Extensively uses the jbox2d physics engine. More information can be found here: http://jbox2d.org/

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameEngine(MapRenderer mapRenderer)
      Constructor for the GameEngine class.

        public GameEngine(MapRenderer mapRenderer)
        Constructor for the GameEngine class.

    • Method Detail

      • addCollisionArea

        public void addCollisionArea(float x,
                    float y,
                    float xsize,
                    float ysize,
                    java.lang.Object userdata)
        Add a collision area to the world, such as a classroom or a door.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-location of the left top corner of the area, in tiles.
        y - The y-location of the left top corner of the area in tiles.
        xsize - The width of the area in tiles.
        ysize - The height of the area in tiles.
        userdata - Any special data to attach to the area, such as its type.

      • getEnemyBodies

        public java.util.ArrayList<org.jbox2d.dynamics.Body> getEnemyBodies()
        Get an ArrayList of Body objects that represent the enemies in the game.
        Returns:
        The ArrayList of Bodies.

      • resetWorld

        public void resetWorld()
        Reset the physics world, for example when going up or down stairs. Clears and re-adds everything required.

      • increaseDifficulty

        public void increaseDifficulty()
        Increase the difficulty of the next world by adding more and faster enemies.

      • decreaseDifficulty

        public void decreaseDifficulty()
        Decrease the difficulty of the next world by removing enemies and making them slower.

      • updateDifficulty

        public void updateDifficulty()
        Update the difficulty intelligently according to the player's scores.

      • go

        public void go()
        Start the timers that control the physics and render loops.

      • decreasePoints

        public void decreasePoints(double amount)
        Decrease the player's number of points by a certain amount. If this brings the number of points below zero, the difficulty is reduced.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to decrease it by.

      • increasePoints

        public void increasePoints(double amount)
        Increase the player's number of points.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to increase it by.

        The location of the player.

        public void setPlayerLocation(double[] location)
        Set the initial location of a player, in tiles. Used for changing floors.
        Parameters:
        location - The location of the player.

      • stopAll

        public void stopAll()
        Stop all the timers without creating new ones, for example when switching floors.
